title: 1 arrested, 2 sought after K-9 shot following carjacking Anderson County police dog shot and killed by suspect
content:
ANDERSON, S.C. — Deputies said they have arrested one man and are looking for two others after a police dog was fatally shot following a carjacking in Anderson County.
Sheriff John Skipper tells local media outlets that 23-year-old Sergio Martin has been charged with attempted murder and shooting a K-9.
Skipper says officers on Wednesday spotted a vehicle involved in a carjacking and approached it. The suspects ran, and officers sent Hyco, a 7-year-old German Shepherd, after them.
The dog was shot and was pronounced dead at a veterinary clinic.
Martin was in jail Thursday, and it wasn’t known if he had an attorney.
